result.execSummary:
The defendant Efrem Dwight Sanders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court ordered defendant to serve 300 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 75 (seventy-five) days time served, The Court granted Huber privileges, pursuant to 303.08 Wis. Stats. for House of Corrections work program ONLY:

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by September 29, 2017, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Court ordered all non-mandatory costs waived.


AS TO COUNT 3:

The Court ordered defendant to serve 250 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 (zero) days time served, The Court granted Huber privileges, pursuant to 303.08 Wis. Stats. for House of Corrections work program ONLY:

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by September 29, 2017, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Court ordered all non-mandatory costs waived.

Filed,

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Efrem Dwight Sanders in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Efrem Dwight Sanders in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

AS TO COUNTS 2 & 4:

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered counts dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR NEXT SCHEDULED HEARING.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Efrem Dwight Sanders not in court, in custody and not produced.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court via-telephone, defendant Efrem Dwight Sanders not in court, in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe and Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Efrem Dwight Sanders not in court, defendant in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for bail-bond hearing. Defense counsel Mark Dluzak is unavailable for today's proceedings.   Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

BRANCH 45 (RESERVE)  FOR BRANCH 37 (DEE) 
Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, Defendant Efrem Dwight Sanders not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with PICK N SAVE, 67TH & NATIONAL.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Efrem Dwight Sanders in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Efrem Dwight Sanders in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.  Case is adjourned to BRANCH 45 FOR BRANCH 37.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
